{{other people|John Chamberlain}} {{Infobox military person |name=John Loomis Chamberlain |birth_date={{birth date|1858|01|20}} |death_date={{death date and age|1948|11|14|1858|01|20}} |birth_place=[[Livonia (town), New York|South Livonia, New York]] |death_place=[[Washington, D.C.]] |placeofburial= |placeofburial_label=Place of Burial |image=John L Chamberlain.jpg |caption=John L. Chamberlain |allegiance=[[United States|United States of America]] |branch=[[United States Army]] |serviceyears=1880–1921 |rank=[[Major general (United States)|Major General]] |commands=[[List of Inspectors General of the U.S. Army|Inspector General of the U. S. Army]] |battles=[[American Indian Wars]]
[[Spanish–American War]]
[[Philippine–American War]]
[[World War I]] |awards=[[Army Distinguished Service Medal]] }} '''John Loomis Chamberlain''' (January 20, 1858 – November 14, 1948) was an [[United States|American]] army officer, born in [[New York (state)|New York]]. ==Career== He graduated at the [[United States Military Academy]] in 1880. He entered the army as a [[Second Lieutenant (United States)|second lieutenant]] and continued in the military service until his retirement in 1921 as a [[Major general (United States)|major general]]. He took part in the [[Spanish–American War]], 1898–1899; the fighting with the [[Sioux|Sioux Indians]], 1900–1901; the struggle against the [[Moros (Philippines)|Moros]] of the [[Philippines]] in 1903; and [[World War I]], inspecting the [[American Expeditionary Forces]] in [[France]] in 1918.{{cite book|last=Davis, Jr. |first=Henry Blaine |title=Generals in Khaki|publisher=Pentland Press, Inc. |year= 1998 |ISBN= 1571970886 |oclc=40298151|pages=71-72 }} ==Awards and honors== He was awarded the [[Distinguished Service Medal (U.S. Army)|Distinguished Service Medal]] for "exceptional meritorious service."{{cite web|url=http://valor.militarytimes.com/recipient.php?recipientid=17355|title=Valor awards for John Loomis Chamberlain|publisher=Military Times}} ==Death and legacy== He died on November 14, 1948.{{cite book|last=Davis, Jr. |first=Henry Blaine |title=Generals in Khaki|publisher=Pentland Press, Inc. |year= 1998 |ISBN= 1571970886 |oclc=40298151|page=72 }} He was buried at [[Arlington National Cemetery]].{{cite book|last=Davis, Jr. |first=Henry Blaine |title=Generals in Khaki|publisher=Pentland Press, Inc. |year= 1998 |ISBN= 1571970886 |oclc=40298151|page=72 }} ==References== {{reflist}} {{s-start}} {{s-mil}} {{succession box|title=[[List of Inspectors General of the U.S. Army|Inspector General of the U. S. Army]]|before=[[Ernest Albert Garlington]] |after=Eli A. Helmick|years=February 21, 1917 – November 6, 1921}} {{s-end}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Chamberlain, John Loomis}} [[Category:People from New York]] [[Category:American military personnel of the Spanish–American War]] [[Category:United States Army generals]] [[Category:United States Army generals of World War I]] [[Category:United States Military Academy alumni]] [[Category:1858 births]] [[Category:1948 deaths]] [[Category:Recipients of the Distinguished Service Medal (United States)]] {{NY-bio-stub}} {{US-army-World-War-I-bio-stub}}
